1.text: The words of king Lamuel. The vision wherewith his mother instructed him.

2.text: What, O my beloved, what, O the beloved of my womb, what, O the beloved of my vows?

3.text: Give not thy substance to women, and thy riches to destroy kings.

4.text: Give not to kings, O Lamuel, give not wine to kings: because there is no secret where drunkenness reigneth:

5.text: And lest they drink and forget judgments, and pervert the cause of the children of the poor.

6.text: Give strong drink to them that are sad: and wine to them that are grieved in mind:

7.text: Let them drink, and forget their want, and remember their sorrow no more.

8.text: Open thy mouth for the dumb, and for the causes of all the children that pass.

9.text: Open thy mouth, decree that which is just, and do justice to the needy and poor.

10.text: Who shall find a valiant woman? far and from the uttermost coasts is the price of her.

11.text: The heart of her husband trusteth in her, and he shall have no need of spoils.

12.text: She will render him good, and not evil, all the days of her life.

13.text: She hath sought wool and flax, and hath wrought by the counsel of her hands.

14.text: She is like the merchantâ€™s ship, she bringeth her bread from afar.

15.text: And she hath risen in the night, and given a prey to her household, and victuals to her maidens.

16.text: She hath considered a field, and bought it: with the fruit of her hands she hath planted a vineyard.

17.text: She hath girded her loins with strength, and hath strengthened her arm.

18.text: She hath tasted and seen that her traffic is good: her lamp shall not be put out in the night.

19.text: She hath put out her hand to strong things, and her fingers have taken hold of the spindle.

20.text: She hath opened her hand to the needy, and stretched out her hands to the poor.

21.text: She shall not fear for her house in the cold of snow: for dl her domestics are clothed with double garments.

22.text: She hath made for herself clothing of tapestry: fine linen, and purple is her covering.

23.text: Her husband is honourable in the gates, when he sitteth among the senators of the land.

24.text: She made fine linen, and sold it, end delivered a girdle to the Chanaanite.

25.text: Strength and beauty are her clothing, and she shall laugh in the latter day.

26.text: She hath opened her mouth to wisdom, and the law of clemency is on her tongue.

27.text: She hath looked well to the paths of her house, and hath not eaten her bread idle.

28.text: Her children rose up, and called her blessed: her husband, and he praised her.

29.text: Many daughters have gathered together riches: thou hast surpassed them all.

30.text: Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: the woman that feareth the Lord, she shall be praised.

31.text: Give her of the fruit of her hands: and let her works praise her in the gates.
